alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 2:58PM CDT until June 02 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... North central Terrell County in southwestern Texas... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 258 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 27 miles east of Fort Stockton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Emergency manager reported a tornado and golf ball sized hail on this storm. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Bakersfield. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 284 and 299. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
